args: So, uh, I've been curious about somethin'.
Why do you think that gold rod thingie\nwas sealed away in the Halidom?
Just curious. I mean, aren't YOU?!
I've actually been wondering about\nthat little question myself.
An ordinary mage wouldn't be able to\nhide an artifact of such power here\nwithout it being found before now.
There was only one person in\nKing Alberius's court who would\nhave been capable of such a thing.
Oh, I bet you know, Cleo.
The only one capable of such a feat\nwould have been Alberius himself.
Wait, that thing belonged to ALBERIUS?!\nThat means it's super legendary!
But supposing that IS the case,\nthere is something I do not understand.

If Alberius was concerned for my welfare,
why not give me the weapon directly?
Why would he go about it in such a
circuitous fashion?
Heh. Sounds like this here golden rod\nstill has a few secrets left in the tank.\n...Don'tcha, rod? Yeah, that's a good rod!
There's a name inscribed on this thing—\na famous sylvan sorcerer from the past.
According to legend, the guy was a crusty\nold coot who spent all his time livin'\nalone in the deep woods.
And you believe this sylvan sorcerer\nof yours created the rod for me?
I wish there was a way for us\nto confirm this theory.
Well, why don't we go find out?
I realize I am the exception to the rule,\nbut it seems unlikely this sylvan sorcerer\nis still alive at this point.
No, but people have heirs and successors\nand junk, yeah? Maybe we'll have some\nluck in that department.
If we head to the remains of his hideout,\nwe might be able to learn somethin'.
It would be fascinating to speak with\nsomeone about this matter...
Tell us everything you know, Luca...
After a lengthy search, the group finally learns\nthe location of the sorcerer's hideaway...
Hmm, hmm. Yes, if I'm not mistaken,\nthis rod was created by my teacher.
Which means the tale was true...
You know something of this rod?
Yes, though just what my late predecessor\ntold me.
Would you be willing to tell us?
Hmm hmm, of course. Though I think\nrather than telling you the tale, it would\nbe faster for you to see it for yourselves.
If we combine this rod's mana with\nmy arts, it will be no trouble at all\nto recreate the scene of that day.
I will show you a fragment of the past.\nA memory of those lost days of yore!
Oh ho! You would have me—a sylvan—\ntake on a request from a human?
This request comes from\nKing Alberius himself.
There is a young sylvan female who\nnumbers among his attendants.
He would bid you craft this\ngolden rod for her alone.
Not only do you drag my brethren into your\nwar, but you even demand I craft the\nweapon with which she will fight?
His Majesty has no intention of bringing\nhis sylvan attendant onto the battlefield.
In the event you choose to create the rod,\nmy lord will seal it away in his castle.
In truth, my master does not presently\nwish to hand the weapon over to her.
This is all in preparation for a day\nthat is yet to come.
We live in a time of great war and strife,\nand danger cannot be assumed to exist\nonly for those on the front lines.
My lord's castle is strong, but could still\nfall prey to sieges, bandits, or worse.
There is one soul in particular in our castle\nwho loves peace, and my liege wishes to\nat least protect her if nothing else.
However, my lord does not wish her\nto wield a weapon at this time.

Because her purity would be her undoing.
Were she to obtain power, she would
surely cast herself into battle to aide her
liege, despite her abhorrence for conflict.

We cannot permit her life to be lost in
this war. The people of the forest should
be given the opportunity to live out their
long lives.
I see. So you would have me create this\nrod for her self-defense.
Or, in truth, for the day her participation\nin battle can no longer be avoided.
She will eventually grow into adulthood,\nand may very well make her own decision\nto fight.
However, His Majesty does not believe\nthat time is now.
But if she someday meets true allies\nwith whom she wishes to link her fate,\nHis Majesty wants to give her that option.
I beg of you: protect this sylvan's future,\nand spare King Alberius from his\none and only fear!
The sylvan's name is Cleo,\nand she is a good person.
Perhaps even the best of us.
I'm glad we heard that, Cleo.
No matter how much time passes,\nI never feel myself worthy of that man.
To think he planned this for me\nso long ago... *sniff*
You treasured me even more\nthan I did myself.
You gave me such happy times...
